title: The Solar System Sun
original_text: The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System. It is seen in the sky and gives light to the Earth. When the Sun is in the sky, it is day. When the Sun is not in the sky, it is night.

title: Minneapolis and St. Paul
original_text: Minneapolis is a city in Minnesota. It is next to St. Paul, Minnesota. St. Paul and Minneapolis are called the Twin Cities because they are right next to each other. Minneapolis is the biggest city in Minnesota with about 370,000 people. People who live here enjoy the lakes, parks, and river.

title: Humpback Whales
original_text: Humpback whales can live up to 45 years. They migrate between the places they feed in the winter and the places they give birth in the summer. They usually live alone.

title: The Lost Generation
original_text: The novel was called The Sun Also Rises. It is about young Americans in Europe after World War One. The war had destroyed their dreams and had given them nothing to replace those dreams.

title: Exercise and Mental Health
original_text: Physical exercise is recommended for management of mild depression and has a moderate effect on symptoms. It is equivalent to the use of medications or psychological therapies for most people. In older people, it does appear to decrease depression.

title: Canberraâ€™s Waste Vision
original_text: In 1996 Canberra was the first city in the world to set a vision of no waste by 2010. The strategy aimed to achieve a waste-free society by 2010, through the combined efforts of industry, government, and community.

title: Electrical Engineering
original_text: Electrical engineering has many subdisciplines, the most popular of which are listed below. Although there are electrical engineers who focus exclusively on one of these subdisciplines, many deal with a combination of them.

title: The Opera Score
original_text: The orchestral score of the opera was published in late 1899 by Casa Ricordi. In contrast to his other operas, Puccini appeared to be satisfied with his initial score, which remained relatively unchanged in the 1909 edition prepared by Osbourne McConachy.
